alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 4:03PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches possible in the valleys and 1 to 2 feet of snow in the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...Schweitzer Mountain Road, Pinehurst, Bonners Ferry, Sandpoint, Eastport, St. Maries, Mullan, Osburn, Priest River, Clark Fork, Dobson Pass, Athol, Fourth Of July Pass, Wallace, Kellogg, Fernwood, and Lookout Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
